text: hey friends in this video I'm just
sitting down chatting with you very
casually but about a topic that is
really important it's one that I covered
in a video a few years ago called post
travel depression so this video is a
second part to that since making that
video I have received so many emails
from people all over the world on a
daily basis no exaggeration I checked my
my emails today and I got four emails
just about post travel depression and
that is because it is something that so
many of us go through yet not many of us
talk about for those of you who may not
know what post travel depression is
maybe you haven't experienced it
yourself it is basically this
overwhelming feeling of depression
anxiety just feeling overwhelmed that
you get when you come back from a trip
it could be a week long trip it could be
a month long trip and the reason for it
is because we experience so much when we
travel we grow so much as people and in
such a short time that it's a lot and we
don't realize that we grew so much in
such a short time and it takes us a
while to process all of that so that is
what the post travel depression is it's
that processing perfect because a lot of
time when you travel your needs your
wants your desires everything changes
you see the world in a different way and
you realize that your life can be
different too and that can be a lot to
take in back before I made that video a
few years ago I had been suffering from
post travel depression for about a year
and a half now I had traveled for 10
months previous and just experienced so
many exciting and wonderful things and
really changed and grew as a person and
came back to Toronto my hometown and
everything looked the same everybody
that I like my friends and family were
all seemed all the same yeah I felt like
a completely new person and I just felt
like it was just so overwhelming to go
through such as transitions
in such a short time that it was
overwhelming and I felt like no one
could relate to me so when I googles
like these feelings I was having
depression after travel I could not find
anything I couldn't find any blog post I
couldn't find any videos and I felt so
alone and I think that is also why it
took me so long to get through it and to
come to terms with it and understand it
and accept it and grow from it I really
believe that when I was suffering from
post travel depression if I had somebody
that I could have related to I was going
through it as well and I reached out to
them and we could talk I feel like I
would have gotten through it in an
easier way in a faster way so I want to
use this video specifically for that for
those of you who are suffering from post
travel depression for those of you who
have gone through it already I want you
to leave your stories below leave how
you're feeling below in the comment
section and let's all share with each
other comment on each other's stories
and help each other out help each other
get through this because if you are
suffering right now from post travel
depression you are not alone you are
normal Travel is so transformational it
makes us grow in such a short time but
so much and it's overwhelming it's a
huge transitional experience so it's
okay that you're feeling how you're
feeling like I do not blame you you just
experienced something amazing but it's
nice to have other people be able to
relate to you and share their
experiences with you and their feelings
so that you know you are not alone so
let's do that in a comment section below
a lot of you have asked in the emails
that I've received if I'm still
suffering from post travel depression
after each trip that I take especially
because I travel so much and my answer
to that is no not to the extent of what
I felt from that 10 months trip because
that really consumed me it was really
intense for me
but I also learned so much from that
experience and especially about how my
mind works how my emotions work the fact
that these negative emotions that I was
feeling are negative emotions were
actually just like a blessing in
disguise that made me stronger
maybe grow as a person as a traveler and
now when I come back from a trip that is
maybe more intense that I've had more of
an intense experience than others I will
start to feel kind of those familiar
feelings but I understand them and I
accept them and I know that it's just
growth and it's because I just
experienced something pretty pretty
magical and pretty amazing the more you
learn about your emotions and the more
that you accept them for what they are
as part of the human experience the
easier it gets and I find that you have
to really believe that you just accept
them you just accept it accept that it
will pass if you have not seen the first
video post travel depression video you
can click over here I think there's room
it might be over my face but that's ok
click on this video and you'll learn
more about my story specifically with
post travel depression and a little bit
more about what that is we gonna give it
a look and don't forget to comment below
with your stories and let's just help
each other out be there for each other I
think it's really important and I want
this community to be more about that
about sharing about giving back to each
other and being like a family I hope you
enjoyed this video and I hope it helps
some of you out there to know that
you're not alone and yeah leave your
comments below cannot wait to read them
and I will see you later
happy travels
